definition: to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I was baffled that some ofthe most basic workplace blunders seem to be tripping people up!
sentences.chinese: 许多最基本的职场失误会让他们摔跟头，这让我困惑。

sentences.english: Because of caring about, but trips and falls.
A father is a walking stick, let us in life less tumble.
sentences.chinese: 父爱是拐杖，让我们在人生中少摔跟头。

sentences.english: Identifying the correct problem to work on is often where people trip up.
sentences.chinese: 人们经常在问题的鉴别上摔跟头。

sentences.english: Be sure where your next step will fall, so that you will not tumble.
sentences.chinese: 要预测自己会在哪一步跌倒，这样你就不至于摔跟头。

sentences.english: But there are plenty of examples of strong brands hitting nasty bumps in the road.
sentences.chinese: 但是，也有很多大品牌摔跟头的例子。

sentences.english: Without experience, we couldn't help blundering and shall no doubt blunder again.
sentences.chinese: 没有经验就要摔跟头，今后也难以避免。

sentences.english: Such people are bound to trip and fall.
sentences.chinese: 这样的人是没有不摔跟头的。

definition: to fall down/to take a fall
a tumble/a fall
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to trip and fall/to wrestle/wrestling (sports)
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
to slip (lose one's footing)
to walk/to go on foot
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
face-plant
to trip/to stumble
to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
to injure oneself in a fall
high, lofty/precipitous
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
to stumble over sth
lit. the horse loses its front hooves/fig. sudden failure through miscalculation or inattentiveness
